entries.name: xml
entries.desc: Returns the element content in XML.

entries.name: atom_validate(ignore_unknown_element, tags, uri)
entries.desc: Raises a MissingAttributeError, NotAvailableValueError, MissingTagError or NotExpectedTagError if the element is not properly formatted.

entries.name: have_xml_content?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element has inline XML content.

entries.name: inline_html?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a HTML media type.

entries.name: inline_other?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a MIME media type.

entries.name: inline_other_base64?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content encoded in base64.

entries.name: inline_other_text?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a text media type.

entries.name: inline_other_xml?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a XML media type.

entries.name: inline_text?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a text or HTML media type, or no media type at all.

entries.name: inline_xhtml?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains inline content that has a XHTML media type.

entries.name: mime_split()
entries.desc: Splits the type attribute into an array, e.g. [“text”, “xml”]

entries.name: need_base64_encode?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the content needs to be encoded in base64.

entries.name: out_of_line?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the element contains linked content.

entries.name: xhtml()
entries.desc: Returns the element content in XHTML.

entries.name: xml()
entries.desc: Returns or builds the element content in XML.
